image.altText: Jennie and Ray give smile deeply at each other in an open-top car. They are in wedding dress and suit.

items.synopsis: A scrap of clothing found by a member of the public is believed to have prompted police to re-examine a mine shaft where the body of an amateur prospector — whose wife remains missing — was found eight years ago.

title.children: Scrap of clothing in mine shaft prompts fresh search eight years after body found

image.altText: An unidentifiable man in suit in a high rise office, photographed from behind.

items.synopsis: While a 5.75 per cent increase in award wages attracts widespread criticism, a new report reveals the nation's big business leaders are receiving an average 15 per cent base pay rise.

title.children: Wage inflation hits double digits … for chief executives

image.altText: A close up shot of a man wearing glasses and a baseball cap

items.synopsis: The 23-year-old man accused of running down Perth police officer Anthony Woods faces court as the charge against him is upgraded to murder.

title.children: Man who allegedly mowed down police officer faces murder charge in Perth court

image.altText: A teenager sits with an acoustic guitar with the Perth skyline behind him.

items.synopsis: A magistrate finds a manager's neglect contributed to the death of Wesley Ballantine at a construction site in Perth's CBD.

title.children: Manager found guilty of neglect over death of teenager at H&M construction site

image.altText: A man wearing glasses and a black hoodie

items.synopsis: Brett Andrew Button, 58, has been released with strict conditions after being granted bail by Cessnock Local Court on Tuesday morning.

title.children: Bus driver 'happy to be going home' after being granted bail over fatal wedding bus crash

image.altText: Bus victims composite

items.synopsis: A junior doctor and "an amazing athlete" were among 10 wedding guests who died after a bus they were travelling on rolled over late on Sunday night.

title.children: Tenth Hunter Valley crash victim identified

image.altText: Nottinghamshire Police officer stands in front a a large building and closed road, arms crossed.

items.synopsis: Police say a 31-year-old man has been arrested on suspicion of murder after an attack that shut down the Nottingham city centre.

title.children: UK police arrest man suspected of killing three in 'horrific and tragic incident'

image.altText: Ringo Starr (left) holds his hands in a peace sign, standing next to Paul McCartney at a movie premiere

items.synopsis: The Beatles — which comprised of McCartney, John Lennon, George Harrison and Ringo Starr — split in 1970.

title.children: Paul McCartney says 'final Beatles record' out this year aided by AI

image.altText: Sam Kerr poses with a LEGO character and a fan in a shopping centre

items.synopsis: Matildas superstar Sam Kerr is back on familiar soil, and says a win over England has given the side a lot of confidence as they gear up for a home World Cup.

title.children: 'That's what we've been planning for': Sam Kerr confident Matildas can peak at right time for World Cup

image.altText: Marlion Pickett is about to catch the football while running

items.synopsis: Richmond have over-ruled Marlion Pickett and won't play him in Saturday's clash against St Kilda after the dual Tigers premiership hero faced court in Perth.

title.children: Richmond stand down Marlion Pickett for Round 14 match as two-time premiership winner faces court

image.altText: A group of police forensic officers and plain-clothes officers stand in a driveway outside a house at night.

items.synopsis: Homicide detectives probe the death of a 45-year-old man in the suburb of Lockridge, in Perth's north-east, with police saying they believe whoever is responsible knew the victim.

title.children: Search for Perth killer underway after man found dead at Lockridge home in suspected homicide

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann speaks to 7NEWS Spotlight in an interview.

items.synopsis: Lawyers for Network Ten refer the leak of a five-hour pre-interview involving Lisa Wilkinson and Brittany Higgins, which appeared in multiple Australian media outlets this week, to the federal police.

title.children: Attorney-general 'deeply concerned' as police investigate possible leaking of Bruce Lehrmann trial documents

image.altText: A tattooed man singing on stage

items.synopsis: Mitchell Callaway was arrested and charged last week following a five-year police investigation into the death of a nine-month-old girl in the state's central west.

title.children: Bail denied for former X Factor contestant Mitchell Callaway, charged with 2018 murder of baby

image.altText: a selfie of a young woman with a nose ring

items.synopsis: Police are seeking urgent assistance to locate a newborn baby girl who was taken from a hospital and may be at significant risk.

title.children: One-day-old baby girl missing: Amber alert issued as police search for 18-year-old woman

image.altText: Minister in his work office

items.synopsis: The Albanese government wants to make quality financial advice far more affordable for households.

title.children: The government is announcing the biggest financial advice shake-up in years. Here's what it could mean for you

image.altText: An anonymous outline of a woman with signs from the Hidden Valley community in the background.

items.synopsis: The first day of hearings in a series of inquests into the deaths of four Aboriginal women at the hands of their partners has heard horrifying details of one victim's death in a house fire lit by her partner. Warning: This story contains graphic details that some readers may find distressing.

title.children: 'He's going to kill me tonight': Tragic final moments of domestic violence victim detailed in court

image.altText: Half the image is underwater showing fish and mangrove roots, the top half is the mangrove canopy and sun peeking through.

items.synopsis: K + S Salt Australia has released environmental studies which it believes show it should be able to develop a major project within a nationally significant wetland.

title.children: World's largest salt company defends project as opponents say saltworks could harm mangroves, animals

image.altText: A Shinkansen bullet train on a track in a city.

items.synopsis: Some 34 countries have high-speed rail or are about to get it. But in the decades since it was first proposed for Australia, no local plan for high-speed rail has got further than the drawing board, writes Philip Laird.

title.children: Four decades and millions spent on studies: Why Australia is still waiting for high-speed trains

image.altText: Gallagher speaks on the senate floor.

items.synopsis: Senator Gallagher fiercely denies she misled parliament over statements she made in relation to Brittany Higgins, telling the Senate that recent events have harmed progress in making parliament safer.

title.children: Katy Gallagher offers full denial to Senate over Brittany Higgins allegations

image.altText: People stand over a map of the world.

items.synopsis: With only 24 hours in a day, researchers have crunched the numbers and worked out what the average global human day looks like.

title.children: This is what the average human day looks like. How do Australians compare?

image.altText: middle aged woman in light green shirt walking out of courthouse

items.synopsis: A self-proclaimed "prophet" has spoken in tongues at a Supreme Court trial examining her son's alleged murder in a remote bush village in Far North Queensland in 2021.

title.children: Mum tells court she's a 'prophet', speaks in tongues during trial examining son's alleged murder

image.altText: One hand on a laptop's trackpad while another hand holds a credit card

items.synopsis: Fraudulent sites are mimicking real brands, going as far as stealing logos and brand design. Melinda did the checks but they weren't enough — so here are the signs to look out for.

title.children: Instead of $200 boots, Melinda was sent $2 sunnies. Then came the emails

image.altText: Tori Bowie smiling with her arms raised and her hands shaped like a heart, wearing a red and black shirt.

items.synopsis: The three-time Olympic medallist was found dead on May 3 at the age of 32.

title.children: Former world 100m champion Tori Bowie died from childbirth complications, autopsy reveals

image.altText: A giant excavator at work on a mine site in the desert.

items.synopsis: The Department of Mines, Industry Regulation and Safety and WA Police have been notified of the incident and are heading to the site.

title.children: Worker dies at mine site in northern WA

image.altText: a young brunette woman smiling into the camera

items.synopsis: Twenty-four-year-old Julia-Mary Lane, who is known as JM, has been living in Canada since early January and is heading into her third night in the wilderness of British Columbia.

title.children: Family fears for Australian woman missing after going hiking in Canadian bear country

image.altText: Smoke is rising from a building that has been heavily damaged by a missile strike.

items.synopsis: Russia launched a "massive missile" attack overnight on the central Ukrainian city of Kryvyi Rih, killing 11 people and wounding 25 and damaging civilian infrastructure, Ukrainian officials said early on Tuesday.

title.children: 11 dead, scores wounded after 'massive missile' attack by Russia on civilian buildings in central Ukraine

image.altText: Aerial of flooded Richmond River High School and Lismore greyhound track

items.synopsis: Around 2,000 homes were expected to be eligible for the voluntary scheme, but the Northern Rivers Reconstruction Corporation has revised that figure down to 1,100 households across the region.

title.children: Number of homes eligible for buyback in Northern Rivers slashed as new flood maps released

image.altText: A statue of a soldier riding a horse on top of a monument with names listed

items.synopsis: One of Australia's most divisive diggers Harry "Breaker" Morant could be in line for a posthumous honour of sorts, more than 120 years after he was executed for war crimes.

title.children: This divisive digger was executed for war crimes — but defenders want his name on a war memorial

image.altText: A woman voting at night at a cardboard polling booth

items.synopsis: Young people are increasingly concerned about the future of the planet and want to have a say, according to organisers of the Make It 16 campaign.

title.children: Campaign kicks off to lower the compulsory voting age to 16

image.altText: Fiona Mardling smiling in a portrait, wearing a blue clinic uniform and a stethscope around her neck.

items.synopsis: Nurses outside of hospitals say they are not being used to their full capacity, with one group blaming Medicare rules for holding them back.

title.children: Fiona has three decades of experience as a nurse but Medicare says her time is worth $12.70

image.altText: A composite image of three people on stage wearing long gowns

items.synopsis: This year's Tony Awards were almost cancelled because of the Writers Guild of America strike blazing through Hollywood. But the show must go on — and so it did.

title.children: No scripts and a win for inclusivity — Tony Awards make history amidst Hollywood's writer's strike
